## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to assist you in understanding Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
Yeah, I've been looking into blockchains launched using Verus. What are the key features of those?

**AI Assistant:**
Blockchains launched using Verus have several key features, including: full interoperability with other Verus-based blockchains, customizability to suit specific use cases, independence from other blockchains, and L1 features such as multi-currency support, DeFi capabilities, self-sovereign identities, privacy technology, and high performance. Does that help clarify things?

**User:**
That does, thanks. One of those features stood out to me - L1 Multi-currency. What is that, and what features does it offer?

**AI Assistant:**
L1 Multi-currency is a feature of Verus-based blockchains that allows for the creation of consensus layer basket currencies (e.g., liquidity pools) and simple token currencies. It also enables decentralized crowdfund mechanisms. This feature gives a lot of flexibility to the users of your blockchain. Do you have any further questions about L1 Multi-currency?

**User:**
No, that makes sense. Another feature I saw was L1 DeFi. What is that, and what benefits does it offer?

**AI Assistant:**
L1 DeFi is a feature of Verus-based blockchains that offers consensus layer Automated Market Makers (AMMs), which are MEV-free (i.e., they do not allow front-running or back-running). This feature solves all conversions simultaneously within a block and provides a fully decentralized marketplace. The benefit here is that you get a decentralized marketplace that is resistant to certain types of market manipulation. Do you have any further questions about L1 DeFi?

**User:**
No, that's clear. What about L1 VerusID? What features does it offer?

**AI Assistant:**
L1 VerusID is a feature of Verus-based blockchains that offers consensus layer self-sovereign identities. It provides a namespace for currencies, tokens, and PBaaS-blockchains, as well as friendly-name addresses. VerusIDs are revocable, recoverable, and can be bound to any type of data, including NFTs and profiles. This feature gives users a lot of control over their digital identity. Do you have any further questions about L1 VerusID?

**User:**
No, that makes sense. I've been thinking about launching a PBaaS-chain using Verus. How do I do that?

**AI Assistant:**
To launch a PBaaS-chain using Verus, you need to have a VerusID and 10,000 VRSC, which will be split between the Verus block producers and the block producers of the newly launched chain. No programming is required, and you can create your own token currency or full-fledged blockchain with DeFi capabilities. It's a relatively straightforward process, and the Verus community is here to help.

**User:**
What's the benefit of launching a PBaaS-chain using Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The benefit of launching a PBaaS-chain using Verus is that you get a complete, multi-currency, VerusID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. Additionally, you can join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon, which will help improve your blockchain. You essentially get a fully-fledged blockchain with a lot of features and a community backing it.

**User:**
One last question - what are DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets allow any VerusID owner to define basket currencies with one or more reserves backing the currency, at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. This enables the creation of customized currencies with flexible reserve requirements. It's a very powerful feature that gives users a lot of control over their currencies. Do you have any more questions about Verus or its features?
AI Assistant
N/A
What are the key features of blockchains launched using Verus?

Blockchains launched using Verus have several key features, including:

1. Full interoperability with other Verus-based blockchains.
2. Customizability to suit specific use cases.
3. Independence from other blockchains.
4. L1 features such as multi-currency support, DeFi capabilities, self-sovereign identities, privacy technology, and high performance.

# Introduction Launch blockchains that are ✅ **fully interoperable**, ✅ **customizable** and ✅ **independent**. Each blockchain launched has the following L1 features.| Feature | Details | | :-----| :------ | | [L1 Multi-currency](/currencies/) | Consensus layer basket currencies (e.g. liquidity pools) & simple token currencies, decentralized crowdfund mechanisms | | [L1 DeFi](/sendcurrency/) | Consensus layer AMMs, MEV-free, no front/back-running, solving all conversions simultaneously within a block & fully decentralized marketplace | | [L1 VerusID](/verusid/) | Consensus layer self-sovereign identities, namespace for currencies, tokens & PBaaS-blockchains, friendly-name addresses, revocable, recoverable, NFTs, profiles, can be bound to any type of data | | L1 Privacy | Consensus layer zk-SNARKs privacy technology | | 51% hash attack resistant | 50% proof-of-work, 50% proof-of-stake. [Read the paper here.](https://verus.io/papers/VerusPoP.pdf) | | 75 - 800 TPS | High performance blockchain, adjustable block times 10 secs - 2 mins | | Scaling | Scale out by deploying more interoperable, interconnected PBaaS-chains |It costs 10,000 VRSC to launch a PBaaS-chain. 5000 goes to the Verus block producers, 5000 goes to the block producers of the newly launched chain.## Launch without programming needed Enables any user with VerusID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, VerusID-issuing 50% PoW/50% PoS, [51% hash attack resistant](https://verus.io/papers/VerusPoP.pdf) blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it.All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, VerusID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.## DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets Any VerusID owner may define basket currencies, with one or more reserves backing the currency, at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing.
